pull.title: cleanse: switch to SecureZeroMemory for Windows cross-compile
pull.body: This PR switches our Windows release builds to use the [`SecureZeroMemory()`](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/windows/desktop/legacy/aa366877(v=vs.85)) provided by mingw-w64.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ðŸ‘Ž to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#30423](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30423) (contrib: simplify `test-security-check` by fanquake)
* [#29790](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29790) ([DO NOT MERGE] cmake: Migrate CI scripts to CMake-based build system -- WIP by hebasto)
* [#27038](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27038) (security-check: test for `_FORTIFY_SOURCE` usage in release binaries by fanquake)
* [#25573](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25573) ([POC] guix: produce a fully `-static-pie` bitcoind by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

Concept ACK

Using SecureZeroMemory when it's available on Windows makes a lot of sense imo.

cleanse: Use SecureZeroMemory for mingw-w64 (release) builds

events.message: cleanse: Use SecureZeroMemory for mingw-w64 (release) builds

rename.from: cleanse: switch to SecureZeroMemory for Windows cross-compile, check for usage
rename.to: cleanse: switch to SecureZeroMemory for Windows cross-compile

events.body: Concept ACK. Can't think of any reason why not, if mingw supports it.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -152,6 +152,24 @@ def check_PE_Canary(binary) -> bool:
     '''
     return binary.has_symbol('__stack_chk_fail')
 
+def check_PE_SecureZeroMemory(binary) -> bool:
+    '''
+    Check for use of SecureZeroMemory()
+    '''
+    cleanse = binary.get_symbol('_Z14memory_cleansePvy').value
+
+    section_addr = binary.section_from_rva(cleanse).virtual_address
+    virtual_address = binary.optional_header.imagebase + section_addr + cleanse
+
+    content = binary.get_content_from_virtual_address(virtual_address, 40, lief.Binary.VA_TYPES.VA)
+
+    # We are looking for rep stosb, which is f3 aa (243 170).
+    # We search for 170, and check for a preceding 243,
+    # so we don't match the endbr64 instruction at the
+    # beginning of the function.
+    aa = content.index(170)
+    return content[aa-1] == 243
comments.body:
This checks that the function is there, not whether it is used, in the right places. But it may be enough as a start.
Edit: Oh never mind, you're not looking for `SecureZeroMemory` itself, only its implementation within `memory_cleanse`. This makes sense.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -152,6 +152,24 @@ def check_PE_Canary(binary) -> bool:
     '''
     return binary.has_symbol('__stack_chk_fail')
 
+def check_PE_SecureZeroMemory(binary) -> bool:
+    '''
+    Check for use of SecureZeroMemory()
+    '''
+    cleanse = binary.get_symbol('_Z14memory_cleansePvy').value
+
+    section_addr = binary.section_from_rva(cleanse).virtual_address
+    virtual_address = binary.optional_header.imagebase + section_addr + cleanse
+
+    content = binary.get_content_from_virtual_address(virtual_address, 40, lief.Binary.VA_TYPES.VA)
+
+    # We are looking for rep stosb, which is f3 aa (243 170).
+    # We search for 170, and check for a preceding 243,
+    # so we don't match the endbr64 instruction at the
+    # beginning of the function.
+    aa = content.index(170)
+    return content[aa-1] == 243
comments.body:
> Oh never mind, you're not looking for SecureZeroMemory itself, only its implementation within memory_cleanse. This makes sense.

Yea. Happy to try and extend / improve things further where we can.
